      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Description copied from interface: IntentionAction
        Returns text to be shown in the list of available actions, if this action is available.
        Specified by:
        getText in interface IntentionAction
        Overrides:
        getText in class BaseIntentionAction
        Returns:
        the text to show in the intention popup.
        See Also:
        IntentionAction.isAvailable(Project, Editor, PsiFile)

      • getFamilyName

        public java.lang.String getFamilyName()
        Description copied from interface: IntentionAction
        Returns the name of the family of intentions. It is used to externalize "auto-show" state of intentions. When the user clicks on a light bulb in intention list, all intentions with the same family name get enabled/disabled. The name is also shown in settings tree.
        Returns:
        the intention family name.
        See Also:
        IntentionManager.registerIntentionAndMetaData(IntentionAction, String...)

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable(Project project,
                           Editor editor,
                           PsiFile file)
        Description copied from interface: IntentionAction
        Checks whether this intention is available at a caret offset in the file. If this method returns true, a light bulb for this intention is shown.
        Parameters:
        project - the project in which the availability is checked.
        editor - the editor in which the intention will be invoked.
        file - the file open in the editor.
        Returns:
        true if the intention is available, false otherwise.

      • invoke

        public void invoke(Project project,
                   Editor editor,
                   PsiFile file)
            throws IncorrectOperationException
        Description copied from interface: IntentionAction
        Called when user invokes intention. This method is called inside command. If IntentionAction.startInWriteAction() returns true, this method is also called inside write action.
        Parameters:
        project - the project in which the intention is invoked.
        editor - the editor in which the intention is invoked.
        file - the file open in the editor.
        Throws:
        IncorrectOperationException

      • startInWriteAction

        public boolean startInWriteAction()
        Description copied from interface: IntentionAction
        Indicate whether this action should be invoked inside write action. Should return false if, e.g., a modal dialog is shown inside the action. If false is returned the action itself is responsible for starting write action when needed, by calling Application.runWriteAction(Runnable).
        Specified by:
        startInWriteAction in interface IntentionAction
        Specified by:
        startInWriteAction in interface WriteActionAware
        Overrides:
        startInWriteAction in class BaseIntentionAction
        Returns:
        true if the intention requires a write action, false otherwise.
